lines.content: > ‚ÄúYour mind is for having ideas, not holding them.‚Äù ‚Äì David Allen ([source](https://dansilvestre.com/productivity-quotes))
DukePro frees your mind of having to remember things you need to do. It's,
All you need to do is,
4. Let it manage your tasks for you üòâ
If you are a Java programmer, you can use it to practice Java too. Here's the `main` method:
* Main Duke class file. Sets up UI and loads up saved tasks if any.
* Continues querying the user until bye command is entered.
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
* An Exception signifying the complaints of Duke.
* @param msg The message to be contained in this DukeException.
* Intermediary between UI which receive instructions
* and TaskList which contains logic to process instructions.
* @param taskList Contains ArrayList<Task> and task manipulation methods
* Process instructions by interacting with relevant classes
message = "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!\n";
message = "Here are the tasks in your list:\n" + taskList.list();
message = "Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n";
message = "OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n";
message = "Got it. I've added this task:\n";
message = "Got it. I've added this task:\n";
message = "Got it. I've added this task:\n";
message = "‚òπ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(\n";
* Save tasks to local hard drive and loading it when program starts.
* Load tasks saved in local hard disk.
* If no previously saved file, create a new blank file.
* @return An ArrayList of tasks for Duke to do CRUD operations on.
* @throws IOException Due to possible faulty inputs
// first character in instruction shows if task is completed
* Save tasks into a file in local hard drive.
System.out.println("Your tasks have been successfully saved! :-)");
System.out.println("Sorry, unable to save your tasks right now.");
* Stores array of Tasks and handles any manipulation of tasks in array.
* Constructor to load previously saved tasks if any.
* Else creates a new blank .txt file.
// Loads saved file if it exists, else creates empty new file
* Checks if taskList is currently empty.
* List out all current tasks with their completion status.
* @param index Index of task to mark as completed.
* @return Task that was marked as completed.
* @param index Index of task to mark as incomplete.
* @return Task that was marked as incomplete.
* @param index Index of task to be deleted.
*              All subsequent tasks index will be moved up.
* Add task (todo, deadline, event) to list of tasks.
* @return Task to be added as well as successful prompt.
message += String.format("Now you have %d %s in the list.\n", tasks.size(), s);
* Find all tasks that contains keyword provided.
* @return List of tasks that contains keyword.
return "There are no matching tasks in your list.\n";
String searchList = "Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n";
* Encodes tasks into a paragraph of text.
* Encoded text is passed to storage to save
* Handles User Interface. Intermediary between main program and instruction processing.
* Constructor for UI. Creates Parser for logic processing.
* Passes received instruction to parser to process.
* Sets isBye to true if bye command received.
* @param instr Full instruction keyed in by user.
* @return true if bye command is received.
* Pre-written greeting message to greet users during boot up.
msg += "You have no previously saved tasks.\n";
msg += "Your previously saved tasks have been successfully loaded!\n";
msg += "How can I help you today?\n";
* Template to print all of Duke's comments.
* @param msg Message to print within lines.
* Inherits abstract class Task. Characterised by description and due date.
* @param instruction full instruction keyed in by user
public Deadline(String instruction) throws DukeException, DateTimeParseException {
throw new DukeException("You forgot to include a deadline.\nUsage: 'deadline task /by YYYY-MM-DD'\n");
* Inherits abstract class Task. Characterised by description, start and end time.
* @param instruction full instruction keyed in by user
* Abstract class to be inherited by specific types of tasks. Some common task manipulation methods implemented.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Inherits abstract class Task. Characterised by description only.
* @param instruction full instruction keyed in by user
Todo todo = new Todo("todo buy chicken rice");
Todo todo = new Todo("BUY CHICKEN RICE");
Todo todo = new Todo("BUY CHICKEN RICE");
